titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Richard A. Stratton papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Helena Ong

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-11T15:20-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Collection processed and described by Helena Ong.
Finding aid updated to reflect incremental materials by Rachel Yamada.

physdesc.extent: 26 manuscript boxes, 3 videocassette boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 1 audio cassette box, 1 card file box, 4 motion picture film reels, 1 oversize tube

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoirs, speeches and writings, interview transcripts, memoranda, conference proceedings, flight logs, military records, personal documents, printed matter, and audiovisual material relating to American prisoners of war and persons missing in action during the Vietnam War, and to the treatment of released prisoners in North Vietnam. Includes some papers of Alice M. Stratton, deputy assistant secretary of the Navy for forces support and family, and wife of Richard A. Stratton.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual or digital material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Richard A. Stratton papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1975, with increments received in 1978, 1993, 2013, and 2015.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

eventgrp.event: Assigned Private in the 211th Calvary Reconnaissance Squadron
Bachelor of Arts, History and Government, Georgetown University
Enlisted in Navy as naval aviation cadet
Joined Carrier Air Group Nine, Attack Squadron Ninety-four aboard USS Ranger; deployed to Western Pacific

chronitem.event: Assigned to Naval Reserve Office Training Corps Unit Stanford

eventgrp.event: Master of Arts, International Relations, Stanford University
Assigned as aide and executive assistant to the Deputy Direction, Joint Strategic Planning Staff, Strategic Air Command Headquarters, Offutt Air Force Base, Nebraska

chronitem.event: Joined Carrier Air Wing Nineteen, Attack Squadron One Ninety-two; deployed aboard the USS Ticonderoga to Tonkin Gulf, Southeast Asia
Captured as a prisoner of war in North Vietnam within Fourth Allied POW Wing, Hanoi, North Vietnam
Released as part of Operation Homecoming
Executive Officer of Naval Plant Representative Office, Strategic Systems Project Office, Lockheed Missiles and Space Company

eventgrp.event: Assigned Commanding Officer, Navy Recruiting District, New York, East Meadow

chronitem.event: Commander, Recruiting Area Five, Great Lakes NTS, North Chicago, Illinois
Deputy for Operations, U.S. Naval Academy, Annapolis, Maryland
Director, Naval Academy Preparatory School, NETC, Newport Rhode Island
Master of Social Work, Rhode Island College, School of Social Work
Chairman, Department of Veterans Affairs Advisory Committee on Prisoners of War
Contract counselor for sailors and families at Naval Submarine Base Kings Bay, Georgia and Naval Station Mayport, Florida

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Richard A. Stratton papers consist of correspondence, speeches and writings, memoranda, interview transcripts conference proceedings, printed matter, and audiovisual material relating to American prisoners of war and persons missing in action during the Vietnam War, and to the treatment of released prisoners in North Vietnam. The collection includes some papers of his wife, Alice M. Stratton, Deputy Assistant Secretary of the Navy for Force Support and Families (sometimes also referred to as "Personnel and Families"). The collection reflects Stratton's career both as a Navy pilot and social worker, as well as Alice Stratton's work for families of Naval officers and American POWs.

The Military Career File contains material relating to Richard Stratton's work in the Navy before and after the Vietnam War, including his Navy recruitment and courses he taught. The Alice M. Stratton File includes letters she received in response to a letter-writing campaign she conducted on behalf of Richard Stratton, as well as material relating to her work as deputy assistant secretary of the Navy after the Vietnam War. The Photographs series includes scenes of Stratton as a prisoner of war in North Vietnam's "Hanoi Hilton," as well as photographs by American photojournalist Lee Lockwood taken for Life magazine.
Throughout the collection, Richard A. Stratton is also referred to as "Dick" and "The Beak."

controlaccess.subject: Prisoners of war.
Vietnam War, 1961-1975--Prisoners and prisons, North Vietnamese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains transcripts, news clippings, and other material about Richard Stratton. Arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs from 1975 award ceremony for Silver Star, Legion of Merit, Bronze Star, and Navy Commendation Medal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains news clippings about Richard Stratton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes prints and negatives of Stratton's official Navy portrait photos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, memorandum, bibliographies, and printed matter relating to literature by returned prisoners of war. Includes photocopies of book inscriptions addressed to Stratton from fellow prisoners of war.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence from Vice Admiral James B. Stockdale, a friend and fellow prisoner of war. Stockdale was also a historian and research fellow of the Hoover Institution.

did.unittitle: "POW Handwriting as an Indicator of Stress, 1967-1973,"
"First African Regional Conference of the International Labor Organization,"

unittitle.title: Forum for Contemporary History,

did.unittitle: Interview with Commander Richard A. Stratton by Captain Paul B. Ryan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Three typescript copies of Stratton's interview for the U.S. Naval Institute's Oral History program on the subject of "Experiences in the Vietnam War." One of the copies is annotated with corrections by Stratton. Also includes correspondence from Stratton to Captain Paul B. Ryan, a historian and research fellow at the Hoover Institution, and a memorandum from Ryan regarding its use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence with editors of Marine Corps Gazette, Proceedings, and Reader's Digest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes terms of publication contract with Proceedings and drafts of the article.

did.unittitle: "Support the President in Getting the POWs Back from Vietnam,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a USB drive labelled "Richard Stratton, resource material for Tales of Southeast Asia and Prisoner at War."

scopecontent.p: Includes typescript copy, correspondence, reviews, and memoranda relating to the publication.

scopecontent.p: Contains a printed copy of Skelton's lecture series and additional writings. Includes bibliography of lecture series presentation and a curriculum vitae.

did.unittitle: Solzhenitsyn, Aleksander, excerpt of The First Circle and review by Stanton Evans,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains writings, articles, speeches, and clippings.

did.unittitle: Webster, Steven D., "Maintaining Leadership Under Adverse Conditions,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, records, reports, and printed matter relating to Stratton's military career. Also includes information related to Stratton's biographical documentary, 2251 Days.

unittitle.title: 2251 Days,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains printed matter and correspondence relating to Stratton's biographical documentary produced by KQED.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript speeches by others, memoranda regarding lectures, printed matter, handwritten notes regarding coursework, "The Military Spouse's 'Code of Conduct'" by Alice Stratton, and a transcript of an interview panel for the U.S. Naval Institute Professional Seminar Series featuring Stratton on the topic of the military "Code of Conduct."

did.unittitle: Command history for the USS Ticonderoga,
"Cultural Survival Guide: Southeast Asia," Intelligence Command Unit 202,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A preliminary working draft prepared with the Center for Prisoner of War Studies, Naval Health Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains speeches and writings, printed matter, reports, memoranda, and forms relating to coursework Stratton taught at the Naval Chaplains School. Includes "An Analysis of Factors Involved in Family Adjustments During Separations/Reunions: Opportunities for Ministry" by Paul Pyrch and Alice Stratton's speech for the Navy Chaplains School's senior course.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, memoranda, and printed matter relating to Stratton's work as Director of the Academy of Preparatory School and coursework taught at the Naval War College. Also includes correspondence and articles written by James B. Stockdale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains interviews, correspondence, photographs, and printed matter regarding military orders, Oak Knoll Naval Hospital, rosters of returned prisoners of war, homecoming policy, message traffic, and gratuities for prisoners of war. Also see Photograph series for additional photos and slides of Oak Knoll Hospital.

did.unittitle: "U.S. Vulnerabilities as Portrayed in the East German Television Film, 'Pilots in Pajamas,'" Harley Preston, James Monroe, and Aldo Raffa,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes material related to the military "Code of Conduct," rules of confinement, POW literature, and Stratton's political views in the 1950s. Also see Military Career File for additional material on "Code of Conduct."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains material related to Alice Stratton's work advocating for families of American POWs/MIAs and her position as a deputy assistant secretary to the Navy (DASN). Also includes personal documents, correspondence, speeches and writings, and printed matter relating to the Navy, POW/MIA advocacy groups, and the Stockholm Tribunal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes prints of Alice Stratton's official Navy portrait photo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains 10 office diaries that Alice Stratton kept while she served as Deputy Assistance Secretary of the Navy (DASN) for Force Support and Families. This division is sometimes referred to as "Personnel and Families."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence related to Richard Stratton's prisoner of war status.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence from visitors to Hanoi who relayed information and letters to and from Richard and Alice Stratton. Also see Stockholm Tribunal for additional correspondence, writings, and printed matter from visitors of Hanoi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, a photograph, roster of Joint Strategic Target Planning staff, and printed matter collected by Captain William J. Ruefle in his efforts to secure better treatment for American POWs. Also includes correspondence from his wife, Virginia Ruefle, to Alice Stratton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains letters of support for Richard Stratton from third graders of Shoreland School, addressed to Alice Stratton and family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and contents note
scopecontent.p: Tape 1 contains the 4th Marine Air Wing Flag Pageant and welcome address by Jim and Dot Neal. Tape 2 includes speeches by Dan Kadrovack, Jos. V. D. Rosa, Percy Lemoine, Dr. Madden, Admiral Barrow, General White, Admiral Kamm, and Captain Richard Stratton. Tape 3 is the continuation of Captain Stratton's speech and presentations. Tape 4 contains a continuation of presentations and the conclusion of the opening ceremonies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Side two includes the Voice of Vietnam broadcast of Stratton's "confession," a statement while he was a POW in Vietnam, in which he criticized U.S. military forces in Vietnam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes two bracelets for Richard A. Stratton, one for Captain John W. Kennedy, and one for Lieutenant Commander Michael Estocin. Estocin was an operations officer for Attack Squadron 192 and friend of Stratton. Also see the Voices in Vital America in the Alice M. Stratton File for additional material on POW bracelets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
